website_summaries.verdict: We like the Microsoft Touch Mouse for its thoughtful, complementary gestures that simplify the experience of moving in and around Windows 7 applications.
pros: The Microsoft Touch Mouse offers intuitive touch-based navigation that complements standard mousing in Windows 7
cons: At $80, this mouse is only for those who are the most curious about touch-based desktop or laptop computing

customer_reviews.title: Meh it's no magic mouse but it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after using an apple magic mouse for years ... This is not anywhere close to the same. I have a PC for work now and I only use this mouse when I work from home. I was able to pair my apple mouse with my PC after some research. Worth the extra cost for apple imo. I will admit the more I use this Microsoft mouse the more comfortable it had become and for the price it's not that bad.
customer_reviews.author: cmoney

customer_reviews.title: Better than a normal mouse, not a magic mouse
customer_reviews.text: I use a Mac/magic mouse at work and it's so nice that I bought this one for my Windows PC at home. I like this mouse more than a normal mouse, but there are a few things that annoy me: * Scrolling on it can be jumpy and inconsistent * It has to be close to the USB insert * It blows through batteries Overall, for the price, I'd buy it again. It's a third of what a magic mouse costs, and it does its job with a few minor annoyances.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: terrible product
customer_reviews.text: It's just bad. I don't even know how to describe it. I'm a developer with 20+ years of experience. I cannot control my computer with this device. scrolling jumps all over the place. the back/forward gestures trigger when I don't want them to, even after weeks of practice/time to adjust. I was hoping that this would be like a magic mouse, but for windows. It's nothing like that. a magic mouse is good, this is not.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Lack of middle button is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I hate not having middle button. You can assign a gesture to replace the lack of middle button but it's not the same. Also the "scroll" doesn't work on Microsoft Visual Studio when running in admin mode (I don't know if this happens to any software when running in admin mode). Also when the PC is left unattended for a while (turned on) but you don't use the mouse for a while I had to turn it off and on again to make it work. The gestures are nice but I couldn't get used to the lack of middle button (specially useful to open links in new tabs in Chrome for example).
customer_reviews.author: German Brea

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse, think the stock is getting a little old.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse so very much, I've bought two. Buyer beware, though, the most recent one I purchased, the batteries had exploded at some point, leaving some remnants of battery corrosion on the USB connector. It was easily dry-brushed off and fresh batteries were obtained, and the mouse works just fine, so no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Lorena

customer_reviews.title: A poor competitor to the Magic Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the mouse hoping for a cheaper more ergonomic version of Apple's Magic Mouse, but I was unpleasantly surprised with the experience given Microsoft's experience in PC accessories. Pros: + great shape + good grippy texture on the surface + comes with a USB extension + great mouse tracking + attractive design and packaging Cons: - heavy and large - poor scrolling and gesture support on both Macs and PCs - poor battery life - requires a dongle with requires sacrificing an empty USB port - poor ergonomics given the size Overall I'd recommend competing products from the likes of Logitech as the gesture support and ergonomics are a better fit at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy W. Yee

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but had an issue with games and the button detection.
customer_reviews.text: Much better than the previous generation invisible lasers that MS used that you needed an almost perfect surface. Even the blue light can't work on all surfaces, but the performance is good. I use it for my home theater mouse so it has to work on multiple types of furniture. Warning that because of the way it detects right vs left buttons (one physical button plus touch sensors apparently) games that rely on fast and accurate button separation will not work. (i wish I could remember what I was trying to play and discovered the mouse made it impossible) Battery lasts quite awhile, even when I leave it on.
customer_reviews.author: Troy in Austin

customer_reviews.title: Good Features and Ergonomics, Bad Battery Life
customer_reviews.text: It sucks down the battery like other reviewers said. However, it's so feature packed that I totally accept the short battery life as a trade-off. You have to install software from the Microsoft website to make the advanced features of this mouse work. Once you do, it really does unlock the power of Windows 7 and all the great efficiency features. I personally use it for video editing. This person has a great review of the features of the mouse from an unbiased perspective. Give it a look:  So, all in all, I recommend this mouse, but make sure you buy a couple of rechargeable AA batteries to help you out. ;-) Hope all that helps! -Angel
customer_reviews.author: AngelAndres

customer_reviews.title: Quality wireless mouse, bad touch mouse
customer_reviews.text: I like how it came with a USB extension for the reciever. It is comfortable to hold and use for relatively long periods of time. The two and three finger swipes are hit or miss. They work for me about half the time. The one finger scroll motion (replacing the scroll wheel) works decently. I haven't been able to get the thumb gestures to ever work. It is a cheap wireless touch mouse, so you get what you pay for. I would say this is a solid value mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy S. Perkins

customer_reviews.title: Just get a regular mouse
customer_reviews.text: The scrolling on the mouse is weird, even when you configure it. I think this is more a Windows problem with touch mouses rather then the actual mouse itself. The sensitivity of the scrolling is just not that responsive and not consistent between different programs. The biggest fail is that this needs AA batteries and they are VERY hard to remove once you get them in. I don't know how this passed the product design testers.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Heavy mouse, bad for wrist/hand/finger issues
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an easy to use mouse due to wrist and finger issues. This mouse was really heavy (The click force was heavy too). overall, I was not satisfied with the function of the swipe stuff. It wasn't overly intuitive and a few of the swipe commands didn't even register when I tried it. Physically, the mouse did not move well across different surfaces. my coffee table has usually sufficed as a mouse surface, and this one just feels like it grinds. I didn't try it out on an actual mouse pad, maybe it would've been better, but still. It's a very heavy mouse and it was not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your time
customer_reviews.text: There was a rattling noise in the mouse and the clicking was very hard and hard to use. I returned the mouse it sounded like something broken was rattling around. Also the product packaging was broken into prior to receiving it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Touchy even for a touch mouse
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is a good size and comfortable in the hand; The big problem here is how oversensitive it is, even after changing settings I am constantly accidentally scrolling and right clicking when trying to left click. These issues cause you to hold the mouse awkwardly to make it usable which defeats the overall hand comfort provided by the mouse. I would only recommend this mouse if you are in the unfortunate position of owning a Windows 8.1 machine that has no touch screen. Even then buy knowing you will be greatly annoyed by this device.
customer_reviews.author: TheKeen

customer_reviews.title: Got room for improvement
customer_reviews.text: Quite a heavy mouse, need some getting used to. Some inherent erratic behavior, maybe the sensors are too sensitive. Sometimes the mouse just scroll forward or backward without me touching it. Also, the inability to right click while holding the left is quite troublesome. The mouse seems to be a fuel guzzler as well, on my 3rd sets of batteries already since I start using it from July. One sets of battery per month.
customer_reviews.author: VP105074 Teng Siew Lee

customer_reviews.title: Looks real nice!
customer_reviews.text: All of the gestures are configurable. It seems multi touch does NOT work for clicking both buttons, this is probably due to it being all one plastic button piece, and not having two separate clickers under the button areas. So it's not too useful if you play certain games. Another side note for gamers is that you may inadvertently trigger things with the touch pad while playing. As you can see there's no middle wheel, if you use it a LOT in certain programs, you might still prefer the roll to the touch-slide.
customer_reviews.author: Mannie C.

customer_reviews.title: Not quite the magic mouse
customer_reviews.text: I am a Mac guy, but have to use Windows 7 for work. I was doing research on how to use my magic mouse from my Mac on a windows PC. While I read this can be done, it would not have the same functionality on windows as it does on a Mac. I decided to purchase this, and I'm not disappointed with its performance. It works great for what it does and has many gestures you can use, similar to the magic mouse. My biggest quip with the Microsoft Touch Mouse is that is isn't as comfortable to hold in your hand as the Apple Magic Mouse. I would recommend for users seeking a similar experience though.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: Must have for multitaskers
customer_reviews.text: I loved this mouse so much I ended up buying one for work as well. It's incredible how much faster you navigate Windows with this thing. Sensitivity is adjustable and laser tracking is nice and smooth on every surface I've tried it on so far. Definitely stick with an Alkaline battery unless you enjoy changing them out every month. I have a hard time remembering to turn it off after use so I run them dry fairly quickly. I do Graphic Design and being able to lock windows with a simple gesture is AWESOME. A good idea is if you purchase a 20 pack of Amazon AA Batteries when purchasing the mouse, trust me it will save you money.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Great touch but distance not...
customer_reviews.text: Would have given a 5 star review, but the distance from the USB receiver to the mouse is minimal (about 5 ft). It does come with a USB extension for the receiver so it can give you an extra 3-4 ft but I've never used one before. Other than the distance issue, the mouse is great. Once I customized the settings for my uses, it has to be the best touch mouse I've ever used with Windows 8.1. This mouse also gives you more customization settings than other mice do using the Microsoft Keyboard & Mouse Center. If you are a Windows 8 user and the distance is not an issue, I would definitely recommend getting this particular mouse.
customer_reviews.author: Juuls

customer_reviews.title: Part of a Win 8 laptop upgrade, and it isn't worth it
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Lenovo laptop that I use for travel, test software, and extra glass as needed. I upgraded it to Win 8, and wanted a touch / swipe input device. Two choices were this, and a much more expensive swipe pad. This mouse works, but it's sketchy. Swipes are inconsistent, touch is inconsistent, mouse tracking is inconsistent. The experience is one of more annoyance than anything else. It may well be "my training", but enough is enough. My old cheap Microsoft OEM wheeled mouse works great w/ Win 8. This buy was a Thomas Edison "success" - I now know one more thing that doesn't work for this task.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Ruscio

customer_reviews.title: You better not have sweaty hands though
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool-looking mouse, it's a shame it never really took off. You better not have sweaty hands though, or you won't be able to scroll with more than one finger! And I wish that two finger scroll gestures and tapping gestures worked at all, but they don't.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: but I feel like putting a touch surface on a mouse is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Decent mouse, though a bit on the light side. The touch features kinda work, but I feel like putting a touch surface on a mouse is a bit on the gimmicky side still. Used it for a few days before I went back to my normal mouse. The software install was fast, but the (I think) mandatory tutorial was annoyingly slow. Nicest thing: It has the storage for the receiver built in. That should be standard on more wireless mice. Most annoying thing: You can't scroll with more than one finger on the mouse...
customer_reviews.author: Maresian

customer_reviews.title: Clicks were too hard and the mouse was too big
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this mouse, really I did. The concept of it is fantastic, and I will admit that when swiping worked, it was amazing. Just navigating web pages back and forth so effortlessly was amazing. But whenever you go to click on anything, you get a workout. The buttons require a great deal of force to press anywhere but on the very front edge of the mouse. However, the back of the mouse is so big, it makes it hard to move your hand up to the front click. I have slightly larger than average hands and this mouse is just too big to use comfortably. For me this mouse got a return.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: I love this mouse!
customer_reviews.text: Pro's: -very portable - touch is very responsive - works on many surfaces - you can change the function of any button and swipe feature Con's: - no usb rechargable ability, (2xAA) - If you rest your left finger on the mouse and try to right click, it won't work. it only has one button underneath for both left and right clicks, the left click still works when your finger is on the right side though, just not the other way around. it might be a built in feature so you can use the whole mouse as a left click, but you have to lift it to right click.
customer_reviews.author: kyle2blue

customer_reviews.title: OVER RATED. MOUSE DOES NOT DO ALL IT SAYS IT DOES
customer_reviews.text: This mouse claims to work with WIndows 7 and claims to pan in pan out have double tap and side thumb scroll functionality that I've tried many times and is illustrated in the user instructions. However, it doesnt work. The only thing I can get it to do is touch scroll up and down . That's cool but ot claims to do more touch functions and it doesnt deliver. Since I needed a new mouse I'll keep it for my work laptop ,but since then I've gotten another touch mouse that seems to be a lot cooler than this one. I'd say I'm very disappointed and won't recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Guesswho

customer_reviews.title: not a great mouse
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought a touch mouse was a good idea. After a few days of use, however, I have changed my opinion. It is difficult to get used to the "touch" scroll, which seems to work when it wants. Then there are the left click and right click buttons. Half the time the right click becomes a "left" click causing a great deal of frustration. All in all, this mouse is a total waste of money. I really should have known better when it was discounted so much. At $22 is is still a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Rich H

customer_reviews.title: Hard to really fall in love with this MS mouse.
customer_reviews.text: I have been a big fan of MS hardwares. And fairly speaking, they really make some pretty good products. About this touch mouse, I can only say, it must be a try that MS make. The idea is good and you can actually personalize the touch gestures by your own. But, to the basic as a mouse, it is not easy to hold and to control. My wrist hurts after using it for a while. I have to switch back to my old MS mouse at last.. Sad..
customer_reviews.author: tomatocall

customer_reviews.title: Not a good mouse
customer_reviews.text: Every time my computer went idle the mouse would stop registering clicks. The pointer moved fine, but I couldn't click anything. Turning the mouse off & then on again would fix, but I found this so aggravating I just went back to my old mouse. I've since tried Logitech's t650 touchpad, which is much better/more reliable, but I find myself missing the precision you get with a mouse. So my search for the perfect win8 pointing device continues...
customer_reviews.author: R. Pardee

customer_reviews.title: Good and somewhat bad
customer_reviews.text: This is a good design concept, but coming from a wheel mouse, the adjustment is difficult and not the same. I am very precise with my wheel mouse. However, after switching to this mouse, I could not fully adjust to the new scrolling style. I gave it 2 weeks of constant use to allow myself to re-calibrate, but it just isn't as accurate as scrolling with the wheel mouse. The device is precise when comes to tracking but scrolling is slightly laggy and it either jumps in spurts or flys off the page. I ended up switching back to my wheel mouse with joy.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Griffith

customer_reviews.title: I mean, its not perfect...
customer_reviews.text: ...but its still pretty good. While the mouse is heavy and the touch movements aren't nearly as polished as Apple's, its still a great tool for your PC. The horizontal scrolling is awesome and smooth on all major browsers, and the thumb page navigation is great. The touch features are wonderful, but they just don't always work on the first try. Knocked off a star for it being fairly heavy and not having the smoothest operation, but would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Young

customer_reviews.title: Terrible implementation of the magic mouse idea ...
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is terrible. The touch portion of the mouse is a big fail, just doesn't work well. You can't change the direction of the screen it does. it is heavy and awkward. I wanted a more substantial mouse, but this is too bulky and doesn't move easily.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Flynn

customer_reviews.title: This mouse is junk.  I sold mine on Ebay and bought Logitech  M525.
customer_reviews.text: First day or use the mouse fell off the table and something inside broke free you can hear it rattle inside the body. Uses a ton of battery power. After a couple weeks of use the mouse started getting "twichy" and scrolling uncontrollably and doing other unintended actions. I was attempting to use this for video production and it was impossible with all the functions that the mouse was carrying out that I had not commanded. PIECE OF JUNK
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: Not a very good mouse
customer_reviews.text: Not a fan of this mouse. It sometimes grabs the whole web page and moves things around
customer_reviews.author: Heather Rayne

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: I use a Magic Mouse (MAC) at work and LOVE it!! I bought this thinking it would work the same. It doesn't. Problem #1. The other thing I don't like about this mouse is the textured feel. Magic Mouse is sleek and comfortable. The top of this mouse makes my fingertips feel funky. My son likes this mouse so now its his and I bought a Logitech for myself... Same sleek top for your fingers as the mac version.
customer_reviews.author: S. Krial

customer_reviews.title: Immediately disappointed -- returned immediately.
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it would be ergonomic. I love Microsoft's Arc Touch mice. This is nothing like those. Even after opening and feeling it I felt it had promise. Then I plugged it in and it was terrible. My hand was exhausted after 5 minutes because the one button was insanely hard to press. There was just something about the design that is really awful. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Olson

customer_reviews.title: The on switch isn't easily bumped, and the batteries haven't budged throwing it ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a graphic design student, I wanted a mouse I could haul around in a backpack that was reliable. I don't use all the features, I just wanted a solid mouse, and it does exactly what it's suppose to. It's made it through a semester of classes on the original batteries. The on switch isn't easily bumped, and the batteries haven't budged throwing it in and out of a backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: awesome wireless mouse
customer_reviews.text: is super elegant and powerful at the same time, really love it, the only problem is that is a dirt magnet, everything else, is a super awesome, you can use it from windows xp up to windows 8 without no issues, if you want to add all features just install the smart mouse from Microsoft and awesome it will be outstanding, i use it in my daily use as IT @ Dell and make the my job easier when is about to pull and minimize different systems windows and other stuffs, 100% recommended, low price great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Macías

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Great w/ Windows 8!
customer_reviews.text: When I bought it I was worried about compatibility with Microsoft's up-and-coming Windows 8. However, it's great with Windows 7, and drivers were just announced by MSFT for Windows 8. Highest quality mouse I've ever owned, can't beat it. Even the newly announced Wedge line can't stack up to this. The touch features are amazing, make browsing the web and using a computer so much simpler. Gestures and touch-detection are accurate and snappy. Can't recommend it enough in terms of being both high-quality and future-proof.
customer_reviews.author: Ruben M.

customer_reviews.title: Great but missing one important feature....middle click.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great mouse and works very well. Feels great in you hand and the size is comfortable. The mouse actually has physical buttons for left and right click but lacks a middle click. I was able to work around this problem but using a simple program created by a developer that adds function to the mouse and allows you to manipulate a middle click. I wish the mouse functioned this way straight out of the box but for some it might not even be an issue. The built in gestures to manipulate windows are quite handy once you get familiar with them as well. Overall a great mouse that is missing one specific feature.
customer_reviews.author: G. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Quirky and Irritating
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is decent most of the time and really irritating the rest of the time. It doesn't consistently right-click when I want it to. To right click, I have to take all of my other fingers off of the front section and then, my finger must be all the way on the right side of the mouse when I click. Otherwise, I get a left-click. Scrolling doesn't work all that well. Also, the special gestures usually trigger when I don't want them to, especially the one that triggers the back button in the browser.
customer_reviews.author: Josh B

customer_reviews.title: Get the drive online, love the solid design and construction
customer_reviews.text: First, get on the Microsoft website and get the recent drivers, huge performance difference between the default driver in Windows 8.1 and the current one for download. (This is not part of the Windows Update feature). It feels solid in your hand, weighty and well constructed. I am glad to see a quality product on the Microsoft platform that brings the things we love about Macs to our environment.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Carrino

customer_reviews.title: I like its control features just wish it felt like a ...
customer_reviews.text: I like its control features just wish it felt like a top notch product American companies think if they sell it Americans will buy it that's how the auto industry fell off Microsoft your getting better copy a top notch product and watch the results that's why I shopped around before I purchase American products too expensive and always claiming to be the best hurry up Microsoft if not Apple gun for Samsung Peace
customer_reviews.author: dion neal

customer_reviews.title: Good Product... overall
customer_reviews.text: The device is great, but some people will need to practice using the product to get familiarizing to it. Having owned the Microsoft Arc Mouse (lost the nano transceiver), the scrolling is a little off, but you can change the speed of the scrolling with the "Microsoft Keyboard and Mouse" software that is installed when connected to the PC. It feels nice on my hand and the gestures are a plus, they really help when trying to maneuver windows in your screen.I especially like using the thumb gesture, to go back and forward in my browser, without having to click on the back/forward buttons.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ah, my new mouse!
customer_reviews.text: So, I spend all day on my computer... quite literally. I just returned a Microsoft Arc Mouse because the buttons were too stiff. I thought surely the repetitive motion with such a stiff mouse wouldn't be a good thing.I like to work fast, with lots of windows open and don't need anything that will slow me down. This mouse is it! Very sensitive to the touch, which I love. Get's it done with a flick and I'm on to the next project. From all I can tell so far this thing will speed me up and I'm going to be ruined for all others. So far no problems at all and very precise. Love love love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with all applications
customer_reviews.text: I am an IT professional and was excited to order this mouse. It is comfortable to hold, works pretty good for very basic tasks, but i soon realized that it didn't play nice with applications which i needed to do my job. The scroll does not work on any MMC console. It is under sensitive in some applications and over sensitive in others. sure you can customize the mouse per application however this is very annoying and i shouldn't have to do this. Using Visio with this was unbearable. It is also very jumpy.
customer_reviews.author: Aussienyc

customer_reviews.title: Changed opinion: This is junk
customer_reviews.text: Retired this touch mouse after using 1 month. I Disabled all the touch gestures, even then it moves my screens. Went back to my old mouse and it works like charm. --- This is an interesting mouse, it tries to run on its own! Seriously, never seen a mouse move pages and go to corners on its own. This mouse has serious issues. However, it is not a show stopper - i disabled almost all the gestures except for scrolling.
customer_reviews.author: cchi

customer_reviews.title: Great for its price
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says, even if it does have a slight delay in reacting. The gestures work great. The right click button does take a little time to get used to, since you have to lift the left click finger off the mouse first. One great thing is that the size of the mouse is on the bigger side and almost fits my larger hands, Almost and better than most.
customer_reviews.author: Zorro

customer_reviews.title: Must have for Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: Great mouse for Windows 8 use. Great to use gestures on the mouse to navigate microsoft's new "metro" OS. No middle click. I've created a middle click by customizing the two finger upward swipe to be "right click". Works good. Right click can be frustrating. Click to close to the middle and the mouse will register the click as a left click. You have to click much more to the right of the center line to register a right click. Minor annoyance.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hovey

customer_reviews.title: This mouse works great and its smooth during use...
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this mouse to anybody that uses the windows 7 and windows 8 due to all the sidebar application windows 7 and windows 8 has. Its technical ability built into the mouse makes it easy to use the by using your finger tips by rubbing up and down and using the side key. I love this mouse and I wish I used it earlier.. works well on ALL WINDOWS... Love it !! Love !! .....its easy to use and very agile... Its simple to use.. very simple...
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Vertical scrolling not ready for prime-time
customer_reviews.text: If Microsoft would have spent as much time on the vertical scrolling function as they did on the packaging, this mouse would have been a success. The good: innovative design with very good multi-finger gestures in Windows 8, especially the 2-finger charm/previous app one. The bad: clumsy vertical scrolling - best setting was low sensitivity/1 line but still did not compare with a good mechanical wheel. Going back to my Logitech Performance Mouse was such a relief.
customer_reviews.author: richiejeep

customer_reviews.title: Decent mouse
customer_reviews.text: Was a good idea in a decently executed form. The touch sensor interacts badly with common use; it can be challenging to use without the mouse thinking your also moving your finger around. Probably why Microsoft abandoned the concept.
customer_reviews.author: Entomy

customer_reviews.title: Took a little to get used to
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this mouse for my Windows Surface Pro2 for when I need to work from home. I was unsure if I would like this since I rely heavily on the scroll button, but it's not bad. Just be sure not to hover over the area or it will do it on it's own. It look a little while to get the hang of. Overall I'm keeping it. It was delivered on time and packaged well, which is always a plus.
customer_reviews.author: alissa c

customer_reviews.title: It's a little touchy
customer_reviews.text: I got the deal of the century on this at $25. I hated that Windows 8 really requires some kind of touch sensitive input to work really well and I wasn't about to buy the $80 Logitech touchpad. (That's what I really wanted but the price was too high.) This gave me the features I was looking for and there was no way I could have beaten the price. Not everything is perfect the way the Apple Magic Mouse works on a Mac but it's pretty good overall.
customer_reviews.author: 1BigGeek

customer_reviews.title: Great Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I really like the feel of it in my hand. not exactly small but fits well in your pocket if you have to travel. I use it with my surface pro all the time. The windows 8 gestures take some getting use to and I think the response time is slow at times, but over all my favorite mouse along with the performance MX
customer_reviews.author: Rick R

customer_reviews.title: Too Touchy
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to go with our brand new HP all in one desktop. We put up with it for about a month and finally put it away and began using the mouse that came with the computer. The mouse is too gesture-sensitive and will cause programs to open or close, or your view to switch unintentionally. It actually made the OS more difficult to use, rather than easier to use as is its purpose. I also did not like the way it fit in my hand. I am petite and it was too big, I could not comfortably rest my hand on this mouse.
customer_reviews.author: willikitty

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable product. but could be better
customer_reviews.text: So this is a fairly good product for the price. It may take a while to get used to it. The good: The gesture features are very usefull for webrowsing and general windows use. The bad: If you want to use the right click and your left finger it's still in contact with the surface, the right click won't be detected. So it's very annoying to always have to raise your left finger before clicking the right button.
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: You never want to go back
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is really nice and fun to use! The gestures only take a few minutes to master after that you are so productive. This product makes app switching in windows 8 easy and fast. Scrolling with this mouse feels very natural and clicking has not changed from a traditional mouse. The only problems I have had with this mouse is you have to manually turn it off to conserve battery life and sometimes I accidentally use the forward/back gesture when web browsing when I don't want to. It gets a little annoying since I don't use that gesture much. Overall you are getting a great product and the prices on amazon are worth it!
customer_reviews.author: hotcarbon

customer_reviews.title: Microsoft Touch Mouse
customer_reviews.text: I had an Explorer mouse but it stopped working (I dropped it one two many times). Wanted to try this mouse for a while. Got it for a great price. It comes in nice packaging (typical MS), two AA batteries (nice!), and an extension for the dongle. Dongle extension works great because my computer is below my desk. Starting to get used to the finger swipes (1, 2, 3 fingers). Will come in handy in both Win 7 and 8. The mouse is well-built and so far I think it's an excellent device.
customer_reviews.author: Breeze2

customer_reviews.title: Functionally Terrible
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that stops me from giving this a 1 star rating is the design. The design is great. I don't think it's heavy at all. The biggest annoyance about this mouse is the response. Once connected to your laptop it takes roughly 15 seconds to provide a respond to mouse clicks. The point moves just fine, it's just that any clicking actions do not register for a LONG while. Buy something else...especially since Windows 8 is now on the scene.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Baby J

customer_reviews.title: Not for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a replacement wireless mouse to replace my Logitech that the wheel quit working. This is not it. It has numerous setting that I had to go through and disable. I read that it is supposed to "learn" my click habits. OMG. Stop! Evidently my habits are not consistent because the mouse sometimes does things that I had not intended.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Clay

customer_reviews.title: Depressing turn of events
customer_reviews.text: Oh how I long for the days when a Microsoft branded peripheral was a sure thing. Why I sent it back: -Annoyingly laggy scrolling -Touch controlls are laughably hit-and-miss -Since the whole body is one button, your palm clicks the mouse inadvertently while moving it. -Atrocious battery life (unless you like switching off your mouse when you are done using it, causing your wife to call you every day asking "Why isn't the mouse working?")
customer_reviews.author: Discerning User

customer_reviews.title: Solid mouse, use it every day
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this mouse, it was $15 with Amazon Prime. Now I use it every day at my call center job. It's definitely worth what I paid for it, and I always appreciate when wireless mice have their own wireless USB adapter. Bluetooth can be kind of hit or miss with mice and overall I just prefer this method.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Perski

customer_reviews.title: Just not right for me
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it, but the stupid touch sensor kept getting in my way. I don't want to be forced to lift my left finger when right clicking, but you have to with this mouse. I prefer two actual switches. In addition, the switch pressure is much greater than my last mouse, and this caused fatigue within an hour. It had to go back. I wish mouse manufacturers were required to specify how many grams of force are required to activate the switch.
customer_reviews.author: A. Karavidas

customer_reviews.title: Not Erg
customer_reviews.text: Except for its size (a ginormous 8+ inches), I prefer the. I tried the Microsoft Touch Mouse because, in my standard-sized desk drawer, my keyboard and touch tablet are cramped. This mouse, though, was not erg at all. By the time you arch your fingers up high enough to swipe, it's like you're playing itsy-bitsy-spider, with your wrist flipped way back, it felt very awkward, and would likely be painful after using it a while. I'm going to try thesince it's 2.5 inches narrower and almost 3 inches flatter.
customer_reviews.author: So Happy In Sonoma

customer_reviews.title: Item not as expected
customer_reviews.text: Before purchasing this mouse, I was looking for something I could use with my laptop while sitting on the couch. I assumed from the product's description that the mouse would be able to track better on the couch's smooth, medium-brown upholstery, but I was wrong; The response was "jerky" at best. Also, the pressure/heat sensors (?) on the mouse are not very responsive when I need them to be; They're too responsive when I don't....one must watch how one moves his thumbs or unexpected results occur. If I had it to do over again, I would not purchase this mouse unless I was going to use it on a desk or other hard, medium colored surface.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Being a Microsoft fan, I was dissapointed.
customer_reviews.text: This was Microsoft's answer to Apple's magic mouse? This thing is a joke! The gestures didn't work to well for me, and right-clicking was just too big of a pain, it only worked when it wanted too. instead of the traditional two separate buttons, the top is just one layer. How are you supposed to right click like that? Apple found a way, why can't Microsoft?
customer_reviews.author: Johnathan Kelley

customer_reviews.title: nice idea, but does not work efficiently
customer_reviews.text: A lot has been said already about this mouse. Therefore I will get to the point right away: the concept is nice and I even like the gestures for rearranging windows on the desktop. Sometimes even miss that at work. HOWEVER.... The touch sensitivity is a total disaster. Precise scrolling is virtually impossible without cramping your hands. If you used to use CTRL+Scrollwheel to zoom in MS Office - forget about it with this mouse. It is way to imprecise and too laggy. My conclusion: Get a high quality traditional mouse. Makes much more sense than this gadget stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dagobert Duck

customer_reviews.title: "Special" right click
customer_reviews.text: Cool touch gestures, thanks, Microsoft. But I can't right click naturally? Why did you take a page from Apple's most bemoaned product and only put one button in this mouse? so you know, in order to right click with this mouse your pointer finger has to be raised off of the mouse. If it's resting on the mouse when you right click the mouse stupidly registers it as a left click. So dumb.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: mixed feeling
customer_reviews.text: very heavy and the cursor is constantly freezing. it may be an issue with the software that comes with this mouss. I installed it on another computer but without the cd that comes with rhe mouse and it worked much better. the only drawback was that the cool touch funtions were not enabled or recognized if you dont use the cd
customer_reviews.author: Robin Priest

customer_reviews.title: It's a good mouse - two things that would make it better
customer_reviews.text: It's a good mouse - two things that would make it better. First make it rechargeable and second make is Bluetooth. Beyond that, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: RedRyder74

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, but not great
customer_reviews.text: It's very sensitive at times and perfect at others, bought it for my Windows7 laptop and had to find the correct driver online to use all of it's functions (didn't take too long). I purchased it to ease my working in InDesign, but have found it a bit too sensitive at the wrong times and returned to a standard mouse.
customer_reviews.author: BackwoodsSaint

customer_reviews.title: Thumb pressure can hang/delay clicks.
customer_reviews.text: I received this mouse for use with Windows 7 and Windows 8. I quickly identified a design difficulty that is hard for me to overcome. The top portion is one piece using a hinge in the back requiring left or right click to rock. The area given for your thumb to rest is to small to hold without using the top portion, thus it's difficult to grip the mouse without applying pressure to the top plate. This pressure can hang the right click or hang a right press & hold depending on the amount of pressure you apply with your thumb. I have already switch back to my MS Mobile 4000.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Seitz

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, needs a bit of reconfigurability added, more accurate right/left click
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, takes a bit of getting used to, wish the gestures were programmable and selectable as to their function, and an option for a virtual middle click gesture would be nice too.. Edit-A little annoyed with how it misses some right or left clicks. Really reduced my opinion of the mouse, In general I still like the device, but its definitely a work in progress, wondering how much of it is just *me* vs the device..
customer_reviews.author: J. Palaima

customer_reviews.title: Poor execution ruins product with potential
customer_reviews.text: The scrolling is seemingly random, sometimes ignoring input, sometimes scrolling wildly after a modest stroke. The point tracking is occasionly very jerky. The three finger and two finger swipes do work quite well and their function is useful. The scrolling is really as bad as people say, it actually induces pain after as little as 10 minutes. It seems to respond randomly. The texture on the mouse feels nasty, like crumbs are permanently stuck to the surface. The whole thing smacks of design by committee and build to price. This product does nothing but harm to the Microsoft brand.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Hall

customer_reviews.title: MS Touch Mouse - Access great features
customer_reviews.text: Add many of the features of multi-touch to your Windows-7 system with this wireless mouse. Minimize, Maximize, Dock, View Desktop and "scrolling with rolling" are all available. It takes only a few minutes to learn the new gestures, and once you do you'll miss them when you use another system. I bought it because of a review I read, and I'm glad I did. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: oldbaritone

customer_reviews.title: It eats batteries!
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I like it except for the battery life issue.
customer_reviews.author: GK

customer_reviews.title: Screen scrolls randomly
customer_reviews.text: The touch mouse is nice except the screen scrolls and jumps randomly. I have tried adjusting the pressure of my fingers but it seems to detect a scrolling movement and move the screen up or down at random making it very difficult to use. I have a new (July 2013) Dell Windows 7 Professional 64 bit XPS8700 with an i7-4770 CPU and 8.00 GB RAM if that makes any difference.
customer_reviews.author: KyloZeus

customer_reviews.title: This thing is cool!
customer_reviews.text: I like almost everything about this thing! I have been using it since it came out, and this was my second purchase. Way less expensive now, so very worth it. If you are using Windows 7 and you you don't have this mouse, what are you thinking? Oh, the thing I don't like about it is that the back button can get very frustrating, but you can turn it off. So, now it is perfect!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: I expected more from Microsoft
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mouse hoping it would be similar to the new iMac mouse. I'm a PC fan so I had my fingers crossed. The cursor isn't smooth, it jumps when I scroll, and the back/forward thumb gesture isn't responsive. I fell in love with the back/forward gesture on the iMac mouse; that is why I bought this mouse, hoping it had the same feature. The design is OK...a little chunky, but it's sleek and the blue laser light is cool lol. I don't want to deal with the hassle of returning it, so I SUPPOSE I'll keep it...
customer_reviews.author: bdtorres

customer_reviews.title: Better then expected
customer_reviews.text: After reading a number of negative reviews I was sceptical but the price convinced me to take a chance. So far, it has worked great with a couple of caveats. One is that I had hard time plugin in the usb dongle into the computer it just would not fit into a number of ports (however, it did fit into the extension cable that came with it so not a big deal). The other one is that you need to tweak sensitivity levels to suit you but, after a few tries it generally works well.
customer_reviews.author: simon n.

customer_reviews.title: pretty marginal
customer_reviews.text: Pretty marginal mouse. Very hard to get used to after all these years of using a 2 button mouse. It looks ergonomic but actually leads to cramping of my hand since the arch of the mouse is not high enough to support my palm. The gestures are nice for windows 8 but using a regular mouse works just as well. If I could return it I would. Not the experience I expected at all.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Salmon

customer_reviews.title: I think I may buy another one
customer_reviews.text: I first tried this mouse at Microsoft Store and had to get one, so I bought it from Amazon for work. The mouse works as designed. I like the ability to scroll and flick through screens - much more efficient than the "wheel." The BlueTrack technology allows the mouse to track better on glossier surfaces. Did I mention that you can now flick through scroll-able lists - makes going through lists a more fluid process. So tempted to get one for home.
customer_reviews.author: JT in the valley

customer_reviews.title: NOT what I was looking for at all.
customer_reviews.text: This is not even close to the apple magic mouse which is what I was looking for. Do NOT get this if you're looking for a mouse similar to the apple magic mouse. Also, I didn't find the movement to work very well. I would not buy this again or recommend getting one.
customer_reviews.author: Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings
customer_reviews.text: Great features, I really like the handling, the ability to scroll and control with ease. But it often navigates when you didn't expect as a result of a touch you didn't intend. First one failed, would move but not click.Second is OK. Battery life is short (a week of daily use). Sort of worth the hassles, but why must we?
customer_reviews.author: Bay Area John

customer_reviews.title: Best Cost to Performance
customer_reviews.text: Although the product is old (manufacturer in 2011), it still working well with Windows 10. Recommend the ppl to buy!
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Works good on Windows 8
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Windows 8. I would never use this if you want to do any sort of gaming at all, but for browsing the web and navigating Windows 8 it works great. It also as really great battery life, and tracking works prefect. Gestures still do not work as reliably as on an Apple Magic Mouse though.
customer_reviews.author: Cory B

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: I do not write reviews very often, but figured i would say something about this mouse. WAY TOO HEAVY! The mouse seems to weigh a ton, and for some reason, it does not glide well. Its almost like it has velcro on the bottom of it. I think if they could drop about a pound off the weight, it would be a nice mouse.
customer_reviews.author: MyReviewMyStory

customer_reviews.title: Returned after one day
customer_reviews.text: The touch sensitivity is far too sensitive, and gestures would be triggered when I was resting my hand on the mouse. Aside from that, the accuracy was not good, and the scroll wheel was inaccurate. There aren't enough options for the multitouch, and so it just isn't as useful as it could be. I returned it and bought a Logitech Performance MX, and I'm much happier for it.
customer_reviews.author: MikeyDangerous

customer_reviews.title: Im so glad it did
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd one and It recently quit working and you know, Im so glad it did.. Its a huge Battery Hog and I have never been happier to NOT have it any longer.. It may be great for you and Im happy, but for my needs, no likey..
customer_reviews.author: DanF

customer_reviews.title: NOT programmable!
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping I'd be able to program custom gestures, but you CAN'T. I like how Apple's touch mouse allows users to swipe the touchpad left to go 'back' in the browser, right to go forward, etc. - but this has very specific patterns you have to follow and the software doesn't allow you to add or edit gestures.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Tavres

customer_reviews.title: Planned obsolescence
customer_reviews.text: When you left click it often right clicks because it's on a platform that's hinged instead of individual buttons. Otherwise it's okay. You also have to turn it off when you're not using it or the batteries wear down and that excessively wears out the on and off switch. I guarantee the on and off switch wears out before everything else making it useless. Planned obsolescence.
customer_reviews.author: GUY TARANTOLO

customer_reviews.title: Great for both Windows 7 and 8
customer_reviews.text: This mouse works great with Windows 7, but now that I'm using Windows 8 is even more useful due to its touch capabilities that adapt very well to the OS. The only downside is that the mouse only has one physical button: you can still make right click but is kind of emulated via software and in some ocasions doesn't work. Overall I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Andrés Arias

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this Mouse, No Seperate Left and Right Click
customer_reviews.text: Horrible mouse, can literally only have one finger on the mouse at any given time as there is no left or right click, just one primary click like an Apple Mouse. Bought two of them thinking they'd be great for my Windows 8 desktop and HTPC but are completely useless. Have to hold it like a claw to even get some remote usage of them. Ended up returning these mice.
customer_reviews.author: Wolf Pack UNR

customer_reviews.title: It is comfortable to hold
customer_reviews.text: The device is fully compatible with Windows 8, and has full gesture support, which is a huge bonus. It is comfortable to hold, however, it is difficult to use in a sitting position on the couch, as it is fairly heavy. Also, because of the bluetooth connection, when the computer is running any graphics intensive program, the response is a slight bit delayed.
customer_reviews.author: K Riley

customer_reviews.title: too touchy
customer_reviews.text: I've tried it for about six months and i'm giving up. I never really embraced the touch functions, perhaps because of the main flaw: it's so jumpy. I point it at something and just as i'm about to click all of a sudden it has closed a window or scrolled me down the page or changed some setting in the program i'm using. I thought a learning curve would work this bug out but it hasn't. I'm trying to carefully edit photos in photoshop for example and making all kinds of mistakes. And then even when that isn't happening, mostly i just use it like a regular mouse. Because of the jumpiness i don't really use the finger swiping motions.
customer_reviews.author: STEVEN D DRUMMOND

customer_reviews.title: Right button click does not work correctly.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse is not natural. By that, I mean if you press the right button but your finger is lightly touching the left button, the mouse interprets that as your having pressed the left button. In order to properly register a right button click, you must completely remove your finger off the left button. This is not natural, is awkward and is not the way mice with a real left and right button work. If you are like me, you will find this unacceptable and send the mouse back to Amazon for a refund in spite of all of its good features.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey Masaki

customer_reviews.title: Great mouse but takes time getting use to it.
customer_reviews.text: I love this mouse and all of its functions. It is very comfortable on my hand and has really great functions for moving and expanding and downsizing windows which wouldn't be available on a regular mouse. It does take time getting use to the functions. Every once in a while I accidentally downsize all of my windows or suddenly everything shifts to one side. I think this will go away in time.
customer_reviews.author: Content Partners LLC

customer_reviews.title: Exotic Features Fail on Recall From Sleep Mode
customer_reviews.text: The mouse works well on boot. I find that the exotic functions of the mouse do not survive a period of sleep mode, ande I must restart windows to regain those functions. The basic functions of the mouse do survive sleep mode. This is a good idea with a mediocre implementation. Perhaps the deficiencies will be rectivied in future updates. I will not return the mouse as the monetary amount is not that much, but my purchase decision was not wise.
customer_reviews.author: RayW

customer_reviews.title: Nice touch, but not perfect as mouse
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this mouse and it is quite well suits for work, but even for casual gaming you will need other one. I used to work with iMac, so I can compare to apple magic mouse. This one is not so great, but it works pretty well with Windows 8. Tutorial is just fantastic, functions are useful - I have no troubles with gestures it recognizes them well. Plastic is nice and really pleasure to touch. I am not really happy with pointing device, my Laser mouse is more responsive, but I feel it only in games.
customer_reviews.author: Max Markov

customer_reviews.title: It's okay...not what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: This mouse I bought to use with my Sony Viao so that I can use my 3d graphic design. I love the style of it but I really didn't expect it to weight so much. It's weights so much less without the batteries but as soon as you place those double A batteries in there it got heavy. It really makes your hand hurt after some time. It was made for windows 7 but has way more functions on windows 8 but a bit harder to use on there. Love the wifi ability! Makes life so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Sahadeo Kangal

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I have always like MS products, they are built well and good design. But this mouse stinks. Too heavy and I turned off all of the swipe features (I would use them accidentally, never on purpose). Plus I expected it to be quiet for clicks, still noisy. Looking around for a different one.
customer_reviews.author: EmilyS
